snippet: Tens of thousands gathered outside the government headquarters after the territory’s leader said “all actions necessary” would be taken to allow government workers to return to work.
abstract: Tens of thousands of pro-democracy protesters gather outside government headquarters in Hong Kong after territory's leader Leung Chun-ying declares that 'all necessary actions' will be taken to ensure that government workers can go back to work; protests expanded after police used tear gas and pepper spray, spurring public sympathy for the demonstrators.

byline.original: By AUSTIN RAMZY and ALAN WONG
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Keith Bradsher, Chris Buckley and Edward Wong from Hong Kong, and Didi Kirsten Tatlow from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Tens of thousands gathered outside the government headquarters after the territory’s leader said “all actions necessary” would be taken to allow government workers to return to work.

headline.main: Hong Kong Leader’s Warning Renews Protesters’ Zeal as Crowds Swell
headline.print_headline: Hong Kong Leader’s Warning Renews Protesters’ Zeal as Crowds Swell
